etymology.description: Depicts a bow with an arrow ready to be shot
etymology.interpretation: The character 弋(yì, "phonetic component") represents a bow with an arrow, an imagery that signifies shooting or catching. As such, it has been used as a phonetic component in other characters.

examples.chinese: 这个字以弋作声旁(這個字以弋作聲旁)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì yǐ yì zuò shēngpáng.
examples.english: This character uses yì as its phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 古代学者研究弋的音韵(古代學者研究弋的音韻)，认为其具有独特功能(認爲其具有獨特功能)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài xuézhě yánjiū yì de yīnyùn, rènwéi qí jùyǒu dútè gōngnéng.
examples.english: Ancient scholars studied the rhyme of yì, believing that it possessed a unique function.

examples.chinese: 书法艺术中常见弋的应用(書法藝術中常見弋的應用)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎ yìshù zhōng chángjiàn yì de yìngyòng.
examples.english: The use of yì is common in calligraphic art.
